text:
Jennifer Lopez has done it again.

The actress-pop star attended Thursday night's Billboard Latin Music Awards, where she accepted two honors, including the Telemundo Star Award, an accolade reserved for a musician with accomplishments far outreaching the musical world. And while Jennifer has built an impressive acting career — Selena and The Wedding Planner are classics — she also deserves a moment of appreciation for her ~fierce~ red-carpet contributions.

As seen last night.

Getty Images

The 47-year-old wore a dress from Welsh designer Julien Macdonald's fall 2017 ready-to-wear collection — if you could even call it a dress.

Getty Images

How does it stay up? How does it stay put? What is this garment made of? Is it itchy? Did assistants glue each stripe of fabric to her before she stepped out of the car? Did she even take a car, or was she simply whisked to the event by strapping, hunky angels?

These are not hypothetical questions.

Getty Images

She completed the look with earrings by Lynn Ban, peep-toe heels by Jimmy Choo, and a slicked-back ponytail by stylist Chris Appleton, according to People.



In case her first dress didn't adequately unhinge your jaw, Jennifer changed into a second Julien Macdonald outfit later in the night. It, too, left little to the imagination.

Getty Images

You could spend time lamenting the fact that you don't get to be J.Lo or that no other human looks like this — or you could just be grateful for her existence. The world seems a little more OK with this woman in it.
authors: Kaitlin Menza Is A Freelance Features Writer.
title: We Are Living for Jennifer Lopez's Latest Outfit
